terms.termDef: Primitive notion - term that is not using any of previously-defined terms
Reality - the objectively existing world in the broadest sense. {Primitive notion}
Quark - undividible {elementary particle}, known at the moment
Matter - any substance in {reality} that has {mass} and {volume}
Entity - something that can be seen as separate from any other objects. {Primitive notion}
Property - a common characteristic that does not exist by itself, but the possession of which can be attributed to many different {entities}
Measurement - act of {comparison} of some {property} with property {etalon}
Value - some {number} or {category} that has meaning in specific context
Constant - well defined and not changing {value} or {abstract item}
Function - strict rule that for each {entity} from some {set} X assigns exactly one {entity} from some {set} Y
Conserved quantity - {function} of a {system} of the dependent variables, the {value} of which remains {constant} along each trajectory of the {system}
Property value - {value} or {category} received as a result of {measurement} or {calculation} of some {property}
State - some fixed {set} of {properties} and {property values}, describing specific {entity}
Existence - {property} of an {entity} to interact with {reality}
Physical object - {existing} {entity}
Abstract entity - {entity} that does not {exist} by itself, but is the result of a generalization of other {entities}
Category - {set}, all {entities} of which fit some predefined rule
Categoryzation - {set} of consistent rules that groups {entities} into some (often {mutually exclusive}) {categories}
Physical quantity - {property} of {physical object} or {system}, which is possible to {measure}
Set - group of any {entities}
Subset - {set}, all {entities} of which are contained in another {set}
System - {set} of interacting {physical objecs}
Reversibility - ability of a {system} or {model} to return to a previous {state}, or the ability of {property} to return to a previous {property value}
Irreversibility - impossibility of {system} or {model} to return to previous {state} or impossibility of {property} to return to previous {property value}
Sequence - {ordered} {set} of {entities}
Time - {irreversible}, one directional {sequence} of changes occuring in {reality}
Dimension - some extent in which {entities} can take some different places
Space - not empty {set} of independent {dimensions}
Volume - part of {space} occupied by some {physical object}
Particle - simple {physical object} with {measurable} {coordinates} and maybe {volume}, and other {properties}
Elementary particle - a {particle} that is not composed of other {particles}
Point - {abstract entity}, that can be described with it's {position} only
Model - {set} of interacting {abstract entities}, that behaves similar to some {system}
Three dimensional space - {space} having three {dimensions}
Spacetime - {model} that combines the {three dimensional space} and one {dimension} of {time} into a single four-dimensional {space}
Event - change of {physical object} or {system} that has specific point in {spacetime}
Process - {sequence} of {events} that happened to the {system} during a {time interval}

Causality - influence by which one {event}, {process}, {state}, or {entity} (a cause) contributes to the production of another {event}, {process}, {state}, or {entity} (an effect) where the cause is partly responsible for the effect, and the effect is partly dependent on the cause

Etalon - an {physical object} with {conserved quantity}, or {system} with {conserved quantity}, or experiment that helps to receive some {constant}, which can be used to compare and assign some {value} to some {property}
Interval - {set} of all possible {points} on {line} between start {point} and end {point}
Time point - {point} on {time} {dimension}
Time interval - {interval} on {time} {dimension}
Motion - {process} of {position} change
Particle generations - {categorization} of {elementary particles} into 3 {sets} based on their {mass} and {quantum numbers}
Empty set - a {set} with no {entities}
Pair - a {set} with two {entities}
Relation - exact rule, describing a connection between two or more {entities}
Origin - {point}, all {coordinates} of which are equal to zero
Line - infinitely long one-{dimensional} {entity} with no width, depth, or curvature.
Ray - part of a {line} that has a start {point} and all {points} on one side of the start {point}
Axis - a {line} along one of the {dimensions} with a {origin} and a {set} of periodic numbered {points} on it
Direction - a specific name for a {ray}, started from {origin} and oriented along {axis}
Coordinate - {property value} that describes unique place in {dimension}
Position - a {set} of {coordinates} describing unique place in {space}
Orientation - a {relation}, describing the rotation of one {entity} relative to another
Vector - {interval} with information about {position} relative to {origin}, {orientation} relative to {axis} and {direction}
Force - a {vector} describing interaction between {entities} or {physical objects} that causes a change in {motion}
